newsitem.title: USA: Kodak near deal with Wang - report.
newsitem.headline: Kodak near deal with Wang - report.

text.p: Wang Laboratories Inc is close to selling its imaging software unit to Eastman Kodak Co for about $200 million, Network World said in its Jan. 27 edition.
Network World, quoting unnamed sources, said the deal could be concluded "any day now," about four months after the companies confirmed their mutual interest.
The deal took so long to wrap up because of worries over tax implications, the loss of key personnel and Wang's deal with Microsoft Corp to include its image viewer in Windows 95, the magazine said.

Wang's imaging software unit had sales of $50 million in the last fiscal year and is growing, Network World said. Kodak is currently a reseller of Wang's electronic imaging software but lacks its own advanced technology, the magazine said.
Wang did not immediately return phone calls.
